Features.assessmentDesc: Detailed behavioral screening forms for both teachers and parents to identify giftedness and disabilities.
Features.instantResultsDesc: Immediate scoring and classification with analysis of strengths and challenges.
Features.planningDesc: Customized 4-week intervention plans based on assessment results.
Features.reportingDesc: PDF reports and email delivery for educational professionals and families.

Hero.title: Supporting Twice-Exceptional Students
Hero.subtitle: A comprehensive web application aim to identify twice-exceptional, providing instant assessment results and individualized educational plans.

CTA.sectionDescription: Discover your students' hidden potential and get comprehensive assessments that help develop personalized educational plans

ParentForm.title: Parent Assessment Form
ParentForm.subtitle: Help us understand your child's unique characteristics and behaviors

instructions.title: Instructions for Parents
items: Think about your child's typical behavior at home and in social settings
Rate each behavior based on how often you observe it
Be honest and objective in your observations
Results are for educational screening purposes only

questions.title: Behavioral Characteristics
questions.subtitle: Please rate how often you observe each behavior in your child
questions.q1: My child shows distinctive abilities or interests in specific areas (such as mathematics, art, technology...).
questions.q2: Asks deep or unusual questions that show advanced thinking.
questions.q3: Shows contrast between excellence in some areas and clear difficulties in others.
questions.q4: Shows feelings of frustration or low self-confidence due to this gap.
questions.q5: Interacts enthusiastically with creative or exploratory activities.
questions.q6: Has difficulty concentrating or organizing daily tasks.
questions.q7: Suffers from difficulties in reading or writing compared to their level in conversation or comprehension.
questions.q8: Prefers individual work or isolation over group activities.
questions.q9: Shows distraction or hyperactivity, but focuses deeply when doing what they love.
questions.q10: Shows unexpected or different responses in social situations.
questions.q11: Has rich vocabulary or way of expression compared to their age.
questions.q12: Shows speed in learning new concepts or solving practical problems.
questions.q13: Uses unconventional methods to express themselves (drawing, writing, creating solutions).
questions.q14: Shows creativity or many diverse ideas in a short time.
questions.q15: Shows artistic sense or special inclinations in specific areas (music, design, scientific experiments...).

results.title: Assessment Results
results.error: There was an error processing your assessment: {message}
results.networkError: Network error: Please check your internet connection. This might be a CORS issue - try running the app on a server.
results.twiceExceptionalMessage: The results indicate that your child shows strong indicators of being a Twice-Exceptional student (gifted with learning challenges). This means they possess high abilities in certain areas while having some challenges in others.
results.notTwiceExceptionalMessage: The scale results indicate the presence of indicators related to disability only, and insufficient indicators of giftedness at this time. This does not conflict with the possibility of having distinctive abilities in the future, and we recommend following up on progress with the specialized team at your school.

ParentForm.disclaimer: These results are for educational screening purposes only and do not constitute a medical or psychological diagnosis. For a comprehensive evaluation, please consult a qualified specialist.

disabilitySelect.title: Select Disability Category for Assessment

physicalDisability.title: Physical Disabilities - Additional Questions
questions: Shows creativity or excellence in mental domains (e.g., analysis, critical thinking, or problem-solving) despite motor challenges.
Flexibly employs alternatives or assistive tools to showcase talent.
Clearly expresses thoughts and feelings verbally or in writing despite limited mobility.
Demonstrates high perseverance and determination to complete tasks compared to peers.
Innovates strategies to overcome physical constraints to achieve goals.
Shows high sensitivity and precision in intellectual or creative observations compensating for physical challenges.
Excels in mental or artistic activities (e.g., digital drawing, writing, programming, mental arithmetic).
Interacts positively with peers in group activities despite needing physical support.
Shows mature social and emotional awareness beyond chronological age.
Shows enthusiasm to participate in enrichment or research activities when appropriate accommodations are provided.
